sentence: Amazon.com, Inc.AMZN plans to add yet another data center region to the list of facilities that run its cloud business.

According to a blog post titled "London Calling" by the company's chief technology officer, Werner Vogels, the plan is to add facilities in the U.K. that will be operational by the end of next year or early 2017.
However, he did not specify the exact location of the data centers.
Amazon's facilities in Dublin, and more recently Germany, cater to European customers.
However, since proximity is important in the cloud business, the new data centers will be very important.
The nearer the users are to their data or applications, the better is the performance.

Another thing worth mentioning is that this news comes a month after the European High Court removed the Safe Harbor rules that allowed U.S. vendors to move customer data between Europe and the U.S. without prior consent.
Amazon executives believe that this will not affect the company's operations as customers will decide where to store the data.
Given its scope and advantages (cost, scaling, convenience, etc.
), it's not surprising that the demand for cloud computing software and applications is on the rise.
Cloud vendors usually offer the infrastructure and the related technology as a service, which further reduces the costs for adopters.
As mainstream adoption gathers steam, infrastructure will have to be built accordingly.
These centers include a huge number of computer servers, storage, and networking that can be rented as required by clients.
And thus, there is a scuttle among major cloud providers - Amazon, Microsoft MSFT , Alphabet GOOGL and salesforce.com, Inc. CRM - to add more data centers globally to handle local customers.
